chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
All charges against Jesus Salazar in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesus Salazar is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Salazar

records.addlTxt: 1:12 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesus Salazar appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Jesus Salazar. State advises is not refiling. Defendant to be released forthwith.

1:54 PM Defendant Jesus Salazar in court in the custody of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Rachel Boaz.  Attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for State of Wisconsin.  Officer R. Glejf sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, cross exam by Atty. Boaz. Court finds the State has not met his burden of proof and orders case dismissed. State will refile complaint, Court continues bond until Monday at 1:00 m (4/25)
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia

10:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesus Salazar appeared by video, in custody from the Ozaukee County Jail.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Jesus Salazar. Counsel requesting preliminary hearing within the time limits. Counsel as to bail motion. State objects. Discussion held. Court reduces bail to $1,000 cash w/ same conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
to modify bail, filed by Atty Boaz, Doc for review to Clerk dk

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No possession of drug paraphernalia

1:48 PM Defendant Jesus Salazar appeared by video of the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty. Rachel Boaz. Attorney Benjamin Lindsay for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Court finds probable cause. Defendant qualifies for public defender. State recommends $7500 cash bail. Court orders $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Defense waives time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
